meanings.definition: Occurring in the same or overlapping geographical areas without interbreeding.
meanings.sent1: The sympatric species of birds share the same forest without mating.
meanings.sent2: The researchers studied sympatric populations of fish in the river.
meanings.sent3: The sympatric frogs threw a party together in the pond.
meanings.sent4: In the sympatric world of insects, cooperation is key for survival.
meanings.sent5: The sympatric plants in the garden grew side by side, but never crossed paths.

meanings.definition: Relating to organisms that live in the same habitat without geographic isolation.
meanings.sent1: The sympatric animals in the zoo exhibit similar behaviors.
meanings.sent2: The sympatric species of trees thrive together in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The sympatric monkeys shared a banana without any arguments.
meanings.sent4: Living sympatrically, the birds sang harmoniously in the same tree.
meanings.sent5: The sympatric insects buzzed around the garden, pollinating flowers together.
